definitions.definition: resulting in or providing a large amount or supply of something:
examples: In order to turn the deserts into fertile and productive land, engineers built an 800-mile canal.
We had a very productive meeting - I felt we solved lots of problems.

definitions.definition: relating to the ability to produce language, rather than just understand it:
examples: The English-speaking children's productive vocabularies ranged from 2 to 31 words.
